intro: Monostichanthus, commonly known as the spiral fern, is a unique plant characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features a creeping rhizome with tightly packed, spiral-arranged fronds that give it its name. Its leaves are usually narrow and elongated, with a leathery texture. Monostichanthus thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests.
